website_summaries.verdict: A money-saving combination that’s worth considering if you only use a router table occasionally and don’t already own a router.
pros: An all-in-one solution with basic fence, guard, and guide included
No concerns about whether your router will fit because it’s supplied with the table
cons: Frame could be more robust, and featherboards aren’t included
best for small jobs or model-makers

customer_reviews.title: Great little router.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to figure out how to make the bits come up enough to use them. It almost takes three hands, but I have figured it out and love my router table. I look forward to many more projects.
customer_reviews.author: Denise McCown

customer_reviews.title: Wrenches are to small
customer_reviews.text: Like the table , my first one , however the dust collector dont work , the wrench they send is eating the treads on the nut . .
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: To many problems
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, the depth setting for the bits don't allow them to be raise high enough to work with material more than 1/2 inch thick. The router allowed the bits to wobble. This made the tool excessively loud and produced poor quality cuts. The clamp mechinism broke on the first use and now the router wanders down as I cut. Overall this product is nothing but a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of crap, to much vibration, fence ain't square, don't waste your hard earned money on any Chicago electric power tools, they are nothing but junk, buy DeWalt or makita
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Gabriel
customer_reviews.text: I bought one.. I set up everything but... The problem is when I put the bit in the chuck I find out it wasn't coming up enough trough the table; so I can work on my proyect...
customer_reviews.author: Gabo t.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Miter & Bench
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Get's every job done to perfection. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Fabricatore

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: first off, the router will not come up far enough for proper routing, my locking mechanism broke after 2 uses, the fence is garbage and changing out bits is ridiculous.you get what you pay for but even at this price, your getting ripped off. i really wanted to like this but it isn't possible.it will be going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: BlackGravity

customer_reviews.title: Works well with small 1/2" bits
customer_reviews.text: I have had my router and table for about 2 years. I have used less than one hour total. It worked well on the small projects I had. But...when I put in a larger bit, the motor spun with a wobble, Now the motor is unusable. If you stick to small, simple, occasional projects you will probably be fine. Round over edges are okay, picture frames are not. Also, don't use 1/4" bits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: useless garbage
customer_reviews.text: The router doesn't come up high enough for the bits to clear the base. If you are just trimming a little bit of a corner of something it will do that. If you need, like me, to cut a groove into the wood at a 1/4 inch it wont do that. Evidently nobody at Chicago Electric put this thing together and tried to use it before selling it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil T.

customer_reviews.title: Great combo for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This router and table was perfect for my DIY home projects. You can't beat the price for this combo!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Benchtop Router Table with 1-3/4 HP Router
product_meta.description: 1 3/4 HP Bench-top router. Great router at a great price.
feature_bullets: Great tool at a great price
